name: F. Perishable Roads
statement:
In the country of Never, there are cities and a well-developed road
system. There is exactly one bidirectional road between every pair of
cities, thus, there are as many as roads! No two roads intersect, and no
road passes through intermediate cities. The art of building tunnels and
bridges has been mastered by Neverians.An independent committee has
evaluated each road of Never with a positive integer called the of the
road. The lower the road’s perishability is, the more pleasant it is to
drive through this road.It’s the year of transport in Never. It has been
decided to build a museum of transport in one of the cities, and to set
a single signpost directing to some city (not necessarily the one with
the museum) in each of the other cities. The signposts must satisfy the
following important condition: if any Neverian living in a city without
the museum starts travelling from that city following the directions of
the signposts, then this person will eventually arrive in the city with
the museum.Neverians are incredibly positive-minded. If a Neverian
travels by a route consisting of several roads, he considers the to be
equal to the smallest perishability of all the roads in this route.The
government of Never has not yet decided where to build the museum, so
they consider all possible options. The most important is the sum of
perishabilities of the routes to the museum city from all the other
cities of Never, if the travelers strictly follow the directions of the
signposts. The government of Never cares about their citizens, so they
want to set the signposts in a way which minimizes this sum. Help them
determine the minimum possible sum for all possible options of the city
where the museum can be built.
